pe_description: The Industrial Services sub-sector in Indonesia exhibits a P/E ratio of 9.42, surpassing the average IDX P/E ratio. This year's P/E ratio outperforms last year's, ranking 17th among other sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. Among the companies in this sub-sector, four outperform the average P/E ratio: '###Modern Internasional Tbk####', '###PT Dyandra Media International Tbk.####', and '###Astra Graphia Tbk####', indicating their undervalued status. Conversely, '###Tira Austenite Tbk####' is considered overvalued based on its P/E ratio. Factors influencing the growth of this sub-sector may include technological advancements, infrastructure development, and government policies specific to the industrial services industry in Indonesia.
health_description: The Industrial Services sub-sector in Indonesia, comprising 18 companies, experienced a below-average performance in the last 30 days compared to the IDX. With only 4 companies showing positive price changes, the sub-sector's resilience and health index may be affected by factors such as new regulations from the relevant government body, changes in demand for industrial services, and the overall economic climate. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating the Industrial Services sub-sector is the Ministry of Industry, whose policies and decisions can significantly impact the sub-sector's resilience and health index.
growth_description: The Industrial Services sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced significant growth in the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of 76.39% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 27.7%. This growth has placed the sub-sector at the 9th and 6th positions in terms of earnings and revenue rank, respectively, compared to other sub-sectors. Within the Industrial Services sub-sector, ###Island Concepts Indonesia Tbk####, ###Lion Metal Works Tbk####, and ###Modern Internasional Tbk#### stand out as the companies with the highest YoY earnings growth, YoY revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively. However, it is important to note that the Industrial Services sector growth can be affected by various conditions specific to the sub-sector. These conditions include changes in government regulations, technological advancements, and fluctuations in the demand for industrial services.
